lead_paragraph: Secretary of Defense Donald H. Rumsfeld sought today to address growing criticism over plans to try terrorists before military tribunals, saying he would move in a ''very measured and conservative'' way to establish procedures for such trials. ''It's not something we want to deal with on an ad hoc basis as it happens,'' Mr. Rumsfeld said.
abstract: Sec Donald Rumsfeld responds to growing criticism over plans to try accused terrorists before military tribunals, saying he will move in conservative way on such procedures and review US precedents dating to Revolutionary War (S)
